Yes, there are actually quite a few options for hiking or walking with your pet in nature in New York City. Here are some cool places you could try:

1. Central Park: This iconic park has plenty of trails, pathways and open spaces where you can walk or hike with your pet. There are even several designated off-leash areas where dogs can play and socialize.

2. Hudson River Park: This park runs along the Hudson River and offers miles of trails where you can walk or hike with your pet. There are also several dog parks along the way.

3. Prospect Park: Located in Brooklyn, Prospect Park has over 500 acres of green space and several trails where you can walk or hike with your pet. There is even a designated off-leash area for dogs in Long Meadow.

4. Inwood Hill Park: This park is located in Upper Manhattan and has several hiking trails and nature paths where you can take your pet for a walk.

5. Pelham Bay Park: This is the largest park in New York City and has several miles of hiking trails where you can explore with your pet.

Make sure to check the park's website or signage to see if dogs are allowed and if there are any restrictions, such as designated on-leash areas.
